intro: Turraea mombassana subsp. cuneata, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and lanceolate leaves that are usually opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
